vocabulary.definition: a first or preliminary version of a device or vehicle from which other forms are developed
vocabulary.example: The company is testing a prototype of their new electric car.

vocabulary.definition: broken or separated into several pieces or parts
vocabulary.example: The team's communication became fragmented after the project leader left.

vocabulary.definition: an arrival or entry of large numbers of people or things
vocabulary.example: The city experienced an influx of tourists during the holiday season.

vocabulary.definition: done without being planned, organized, or rehearsed
vocabulary.example: She made an impromptu speech at the award ceremony.

vocabulary.definition: representing the most perfect or typical example of a quality or class
vocabulary.example: The film is considered the quintessential romantic comedy of the decade.

vocabulary.definition: to remove or get rid of something unwanted or unpleasant
vocabulary.example: The company scrubbed all references to the controversial ad campaign from its website.
